alert.note: Alert for Bitterroot, Sapphire Mountains; Butte, Blackfoot Region; Flathead, Mission Valleys; Kootenai, Cabinet Region; Missoula, Bitterroot Valleys (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 05 at 12:44PM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...A cluster of thunderstorms will impact portions of east central Mineral, southwestern Missoula, south central Lake, southeastern Sanders, northwestern Granite and north central Ravalli Counties through 145 PM MDT... At 1242 PM MDT, trained weather spotters reported a cluster of thunderstorms extending from 7 miles south of Dixon to 17 miles southeast of Bonner-West Riverside. Movement was northwest at 25 mph. HAZARD...Pea size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Missoula, Lolo, Plains, Alberton, Wye, Florence, Evaro, Bonner-West Riverside, Arlee, East Missoula, Dixon, Frenchtown, Paradise, Nimrod, Ninemile, Weeksville, Perma, Huson, Quigley and Clinton. This includes the following highways... Interstate 90 between mile markers 69 and 135. Highway 93 N between mile markers 0 and 24. Highway 93 S between mile markers 71 and 94. Highway 200 E between mile markers 0 and 7. Highway 200 W between mile markers 63 and 106. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
